interestingFact: Pakistan is home to the second highest mountain in the world, K2, and has one of the world's oldest civilizations—the Indus Valley Civilization.
France is the most visited country in the world and home to the Eiffel Tower, one of the most recognized monuments globally.
Brazil contains about 60% of the Amazon Rainforest and is the only country in South America that speaks Portuguese.
Japan is made up of over 6,800 islands and is known for its unique blend of ancient traditions and cutting-edge technology.
Canada has the longest coastline in the world and more lakes than all other countries combined.
Nigeria is the most populous country in Africa and its film industry, Nollywood, is the second-largest in the world by volume.
Australia is home to unique wildlife like kangaroos and koalas and is the only country that is also a continent.
Germany is known for its engineering excellence and has the world's oldest highway system—the Autobahn.
Egypt is famous for its ancient pyramids, especially the Great Pyramid of Giza, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
